data.name: A silversmith's tale in the court of Ali Pasha
data.subtitle: Welcome to the Silversmithing Museum of the Piraeus Bank Group's Cultural Foundation, in Ioannina.
data.description: Discover our exhibition through 11 questions that challengeyour knowledge and keen eye.During the treasure hunt, questions will appear. Each of them can be answered with the help of a text or an object in the Museum. In order to answer, you must either scan a QR code or else type the QR code’s number or a keyword in the corresponding field.Good luck!

trials.name: You’re in Ioannina in the early 19th century
trials.description: You’re in Ioannina in the early 19th century. Soldiers came and fetched you from your workshop and are taking you to Ali Pasha’s Serai.What could the pasha want from an apprentice like you?

trials.name: A flintlock pistol
trials.description: So that is what a róka is: a flintlock pistol! You’ll obviously need some silver and the wilypasha didn’t give you any. So where can you find silver?You have heard of a place somewhere where there are silver mines. What was it called?

trials.name: The pasha takes the róka in his hands
trials.description: The pasha takes the róka in his hands. From the glint in his eyes you understand thathe likes it a lot. Bravo lad, aferim (well done)! He gives you a pouch full of piastersand, smiling at you, says: look around you and find an object that is also made of silver. You deserve it. So that you can use it to write with and be what your people, here in Yiannena, like to say: a leader in arms, in piasters and in letters!What object is the pasha referring to? Search among the objects on the second level to find it. (Scan the corresponding QR.)

trials.name: The kalamári
trials.description: The kalamári, a small pot holding ink attached to a case where they placed pens made of kalámi (the Greek name for bamboo).

trials.name: Take a picture of the kalamári
trials.description: Take a picture of the kalamári to keep it as a treasured memory and share it with you friends on Facebook or Instagram.

trials.name: Last Trial
trials.description: Holding the pasha’s piasters in one hand and the kalamári in the other you wend your way back to your workshop, happy that you created such a beautiful object.Years later, you’ll learn that Ali Pasha presented the Englishman Edward John Trelawny, a friend of Lord Byron’s, with your róka as a gift! For you, your pride in your work and your love for your craft will be a treasure hidden in the depths of your heart!
